longTitle.p: Bill to Regulate Sushi Rice Quality Standards

preface.p: Legislative proposal submitted by Senator Tokio to the Senado de Gastronomia.

preamble.p: 1. Sushi has become one of the most consumed dishes in the Republic of Gastronomia, yet quality standards for sushi rice remain unregulated.
2. Inferior rice varieties are being used by establishments marketing dishes as "authentic sushi", misleading consumers.
3. The traditional short-grain japonica rice (Oryza sativa var. japonica) is essential for proper sushi preparation.
4. Vinegar seasoning ratios directly affect the quality and safety of sushi rice.

content.p: Only short-grain japonica rice with a minimum amylopectin content of 80% shall be used for sushi preparation in licensed establishments.
Rice shall be washed a minimum of three times until the water runs clear, then soaked for 30 minutes before cooking. The use of pre-washed or instant rice is prohibited for sushi preparation.
The seasoning mixture shall contain rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a ratio of 4:2:1 by weight. The use of synthetic vinegar or artificial sweeteners is prohibited.
Seasoned sushi rice shall be served at body temperature (approximately 37 degrees Celsius). Refrigerated rice shall not be used for nigiri or maki preparation.
Establishments not complying with these standards may not use the term "sushi" in their menus or marketing materials. The term "rice roll" shall be used instead.
